ResourceHeader.Description: The Cassini Magnetospheric Imaging Instrument (MIMI) Low Energy Magnetospheric Measurements (LEMMS) sensor uses two oppositely directed telescopes to measure ions and electrons in the energy range 0.03 to 18 MeV for ions and 0.015 to 0.884 MeV for electrons. LEMMS measures electrons in two ways: the first method of detection uses magnets to bend low-energy electrons into detectors and the second uses a stack of detectors capable of separating electrons by energy discrimination
